body.p: This type of plugin extension allows you to contribute actions to the main menu and toolbars, create custom views, interact with the application workspace, make modifications to opened documents, and add listeners for various events. It is the most useful and used extension when writing a plugin.

A workspace access plugin can also provide frameworks, allowing you to have a single add-on that provides both workspace-level extensions (independent of any given framework) and doctype-specific frameworks). If the frameworks involve Java extensions (for example, custom dialogs or link text resolvers), they use the Java code as packaged for the workspace access plugin.
You include frameworks with a workspace access plugin by declaring an "additional frameworks" extension in the plugin's plugin.xml file: .
